text: Strip the word ‚Äòdesign‚Äô away and then try to explain design otherwise. Everything becomes clearer. The alternative words do wonders. Many ‚Äògraphic designers‚Äô are either artists or corporate branding agents. Most ‚Äòdesign thinkers‚Äô are neoliberal business consultants.

Got some folks curious about what was preventing SSR...

They were calling getBoundingClientRect() to get the rendered side of the container to then back-calculate a scaled font size. It also had to listen for screen size changes. We replaced that with a calc() in font-size.

I have resigned from Basecamp after 7.5 years and 100+ podcast episodes.

I left my job at Basecamp running the Brand & Experience team after 5 years today.

I'm going to take some time off, but if you're looking for seasoned designer, I'd love to chat. DMs are open, or email me at adam@aaadaaam.com.
@dhh He canceled his own culture. Love it.
Monday, May 3 will be my last day at Basecamp.
I left my job at Basecamp today.
About one-third of Basecamp employees accepted buyouts today after a contentious all-hands meeting. I‚Äôm told more are coming.

After nearly 8 years, given the recent changes at Basecamp, I‚Äôve decided to leave my job as an Android programmer there. Will eventually be looking for something new, so please feel free to reach out / RT. DMs open.

Thank you all for your support and kindness. It means a lot. ‚ù§Ô∏è

I have officially resigned my position at Basecamp. I'll need some time off, as most people do between jobs. But my DMs are open for anyone looking for help with Finance/Bookkeeping/HR. rahsfan@gmail.com
I‚Äôve resigned as Head of Customer Support at Basecamp. I‚Äôm four months pregnant, so I‚Äôm going to take some time off to build this baby and hang out with my brilliant spouse and child.

I joined Basecamp just over a year and a half ago. Today I am leaving. Technical support, digging into logging to find out what happened, and building the technical skills on my team are things I'd love to keep doing.

I have left Basecamp due to the recent changes & policies.

I‚Äôve been doing product design there for 7yrs. The last 3yrs I led the iOS team working alongside @dylanginsburg and @zachwaugh ‚Äî they are the best üíú.

Maybe it's just me, but I love simple, well branded, uncomplicated ideas like this that just lean into the fundamentals really well.
The min of the max of the num and the min and the max. A licky boom boom down.

Whenever I need to clamp a number between a `min` and a `max`, it takes me ages to convince myself this implementation is correct.
